content.description: This is a fun climb that goes straight up an easy line. Maybe the most photogenic route at Delbow.
content.protection: You'll need to set a top rope with a bolt and a cedar tree as your fixed points. Bring plenty of cord/webbing because the tree is about 20 feet from the edge of the cliff.
content.location: Rightmost route on the cliff face to the right of the amphitheater.

content.description: Follow the dihedral up the cliff for some ledge scrambling and easy climbing.
content.protection:
There are two bolts at the top of the cliff. You have to hike up to set a top rope anchor. 

  Or, if you're a little on the wild side don't recommend sling the tree about 30 feet up and clip the old rusty piton another 15-20 feet from the tree.
content.location: The first route directly to the right of the bolted route on the face to right of the amphitheater.
